description: Learned borrowing from Avestan 𐬯𐬀𐬙𐬆𐬨‎ (satəm, “hundred”). The canonical example of a word that changed Proto-Indo-European palatovelar */ḱ/ into sibilant /s/ by the 3rd millennium BCE, as opposed to Latin centum (“hundred”). Doublet of hundred and centum.

entries.meaning: (Indo-European studies) Referring to a Proto-Indo-European language group that produced sibilants from a series of palatovelar stops.
